info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 9 at 4:40AM EDT until August 9 at 5:45AM EDT by NWS Charleston SC
info.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham.
* WHEN...Until 545 AM EDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 438 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain extending from Riverside and Wilmington Island to the Savannah River Entrance. This area heavy rain will impact Downtown Savannah and nearby communities through 545 AM. A quick 1 to 2 inches of rain could fall, resulting in urban flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, Tybee Island, Midtown Savannah, Downtown Savannah, Hutchinson Island, Hunter Army Airfield, Wilmington Island, Windsor Forest, Fort Pulaski National Monument and Garden City.
info.instruction:
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Heavy rain in Downtown Savannah will result in nuisance flooding of low-lying areas. Slow down when traveling and allow extra distance between you and the vehicle ahead. Do not drive into water of unknown depth.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING
